attributes.comment:
Like many Americans, our family has chosen adoption as the best and most moral
and generous way to have another child. We are about halfway through the process
of adopting a child, and already feel very overwhelmed by the volume of paperwork
involved. There are so many different documents that must be obtained and
applications that must be completed, and the overall expense is very high. It is
difficult to prepare for the expense, especially when the travel time to a foreign country
is variable. Any additional expense built into the process makes a difficult and often
prohibitively expensive endeavour even more difficult to afford, and ultimately those
most hurt are the orphans who will not be adopted into a loving home. That money
would be better spent on care for the children.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by David Shardell
